intro: Diploclinium evansianum, commonly known as the African marshmallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its soft, fleshy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in terminal inflorescences. Its root system is fibrous and can reach considerable depth, allowing it to thrive in wet or marshy environments. It is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to high humidity and waterlogged soils.
